title: Woburn man charged with evading $1.2 million in income tax
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jean Brito of Woburn charged with tax evasion, pleading not guilty to 10 counts, including filing false tax returns.
Brito accused of underreporting over $20 million in business income while evading more than $1.2 million in taxes.
Authorities seized $35,000 cash and documents from Brito's home and business during a February search.

title: Beware the birds: Bird flu confirmed in Boston
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Bird flu confirmed in Boston's Emerald Necklace park system; public health advisory issued with low risk to general public.
Boston Public Health Commission advises against contact with birds; bird flu symptoms may mimic seasonal flu.
CDC reports 71 human bird flu cases in U.S. since 2024; protective equipment recommended for those handling birds.

title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, top NFL Draft prospect, expresses excitement for potential mentorship from Tom Brady with Raiders.
Mendoza, Heisman winner and Indiana Hoosiers star, completed pre-draft interview with Brady-owned Las Vegas Raiders.
The quarterback, regarded as the 2026 Draft's No. 1 pick by Mel Kiper, threw for 3,535 yards and 41 touchdowns.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' starring Jennifer Lopez streams on Hulu, exploring themes of connection in a prison setting.
New documentary 'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run' by Morgan Neville streams on Prime Video, detailing McCartney's post-Beatles career.
Season 4 of 'Bridgerton', focusing on Benedict Bridgerton's romance, is available on Netflix with a Cinderella twist.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox outfielders Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a spring training game against the Atlanta Braves.
Despite the collision, both players stayed in the game, with Rafaela hitting a two-run home run and Anthony hitting a single.
The collision was attributed to communication issues; both players reported minor injuries but expressed concern primarily for each other's well-being.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund if a Red Sox player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's pledge reflects confidence in the 2026 Red Sox power; only two players hit 20 homers last season.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora has a history of supporting the Jimmy Fund, including past donations and auctions.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act, targeting instruction on critical race theory and LGBTQ+ issues in schools.
The bill was approved 184–164, with Democrats and a few Republicans opposing, and now heads to the Senate.
Violations could lead to teacher discipline, credential revocation, and lawsuits up to $10,000 per violation.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in the Berkshires are created by adding food coloring to ice.
This tradition near the Hairpin Turn in North Adams has been ongoing for decades, engaging community members.
Nearby attractions include The Golden Eagle Restaurant and MASS MoCA, a contemporary art museum in North Adams.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirms first measles cases of 2026 in a school-aged child and a Greater Boston adult.
The Boston-area adult recently returned from abroad and visited multiple locations while infectious, raising exposure risk.
A national measles outbreak has reached 1,136 cases in 2026, with Massachusetts health officials urging vaccination for protection.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Elizabeth Mallard-Vitiello, 33, passed away on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness in South Boston.
She was a lifelong South Boston resident known for appearing in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial with Rob Gronkowski.
Survived by husband Francis Vitiello and children Mya and Frankie, her funeral services will be held March 3-4 in Dedham.
